titleStmt.title: Juvenilia

div.head: RUSKIN | MS. | JUVENILIA
div.p: A slipcase containing MS IVA, MS IVB, MS IVC. The slipcase housed these Red Books when first purchased. In recent years, at the Beinecke Library, the contents have been separated from the slipcase and cataloged .

W. G. Collingwood omitted this Red Book from the manuscripts listed in his “Preliminary Note on the Original MSS. of the Poems” for Poems (1891), presumably because it contained no poetry. The editors of the Library Edition therefore grouped “three small books,” Juvenilia MS A, Juvenilia MS B, and Juvenilia MS C—all of them Red Books, but containing prose—as “Juvenilia” and encased them in a blue morocco slipcase by that name.
